intro: Aldea circinnata, commonly known as the spiral rush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, three-ranked spikelets. Aldea circinnata typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds.
